page.title: 12CHANGING TIMES 1945-1985
page.content: Changing times:Horsham 1945-1985 Shopping:In 1945 most shops were owned by families, like Hunts. Few still exist. Most shops are now owned by companies. It would be difficult to buy foreign foods. Most food was bought at corner shops. Now people go to supermarkets, Sainsburys or Tesco. Today people have freezers. In 1945 there were no frozen food or freezer shops. Transport:The main type of transport in 1945 was the bicycle. There were more buses and trains in 1945 than now. The roads have changed a lot. You were able to drive straight through Horsham. Now West St. is pedestrianized and we now have a distributor road-Albion Way. Leisure:In 1945 there were 3 cinemas Ritz, Odeon or Capital, now only the Ritz has not been demolished.
